answers.answer: They're both in the same class of diabetes medications, dipeptidyl peptidase-4 [DPP-4] inhibitors. Both Januvia and Galvus [Vildagliptin] have acute renal warnings. You should be discussing medications and dosages with your attending doctor as he/she has a better understanding of your medical history.FYI, there are several class action lawsuits against Merck, makers of Januvia, for serious health side effects and potential triggering of pancreatic cancer caused by Januvia.
